conversation.content: So we're really doing this? Jumping off a perfectly good bridge?

Oh absolutely! I mean, technically it's not perfectly good—there's actually a crack in the, uh, third support beam, but that's probably fine. The company has a solid four-star rating on Yelp, which is basically like having a safety certification, right?
Four stars? What happened to the fifth star?
Well, um, apparently someone's cord was three feet too long, but hey, they gave him a full refund! Plus free physical therapy vouchers, which is honestly pretty generous when you think about it.
[stuttering] W-w-wait, are you s-serious right now?
Kidding! Totally kidding. Though actually, fun fact—bungee jumping is statistically safer than, uh, driving to the bungee jumping site. So technically we already survived the dangerous part!
That's not as reassuring as you think it is.
Look, worst case scenario, we become viral videos, and isn't that kind of immortality? "Local idiots forget to attach cord"—boom, fifteen million views, we're legends forever.
Oh god, is my cord actually attached?
[stuttering] Y-yeah, definitely! Well, I mean, it l-looks attached from here. That clippy thing is doing something, and there's definitely a rope involved, so we're basically golden.
[excited] This is insane! I can't believe we're actually doing this!
Right? Nothing says "I'm a functioning adult" quite like voluntarily falling off a bridge! My therapist is gonna have a field day with this one, assuming I, you know, make it to next week's session.
Your therapist told you to do this?
Well, she said I should "take more leaps" in life, so technically I'm just being really, really literal about following medical advice. That's responsible behavior if you ask me.
The instructor is giving us the countdown. Oh no.
[enunciating every word] Remember to keep your arms out, bend your knees, and absolutely do not think about that documentary where the cord snapped. Oops, sorry, shouldn't have mentioned that.
Why would you say that NOW?
Because, um, nervous talking is my superpower! Also, fun fact number two—screaming actually makes the experience better because it, uh, releases endorphins or something equally scientific-sounding.
Three... two... one... JUMPING!
[very loudly] THIS WAS A TERRIBLE IDEA BUT AT LEAST WE'RE TERRIBLE TOGETHER! Also I maybe should've mentioned I'm afraid of heights!
